25283392.review:
游戏名：Valley （游戏流程约4小时）
这是个用unity引擎打造的奇妙的游戏，我们的主角，因为一些不明原因，醒来已经是在一个洞穴里面，从这个洞穴出去，看到的，则是一个风景优美的未知的大陆，在这里，我们获得了我们的装备，也是游戏的核心，L.E.A.F动力外骨骼，同时移动技能大幅增强，还获得了个能吸收与给予生物“精力”的能力（因为定义不明，这个最贴切）。然后追寻着这套装甲上留下的语音提示，开始在这片大陆探险的故事。
游戏整体操作性良好，游戏环境优美，画面中等偏上，当在使用动力外骨骼，在大陆上自由的蹦跑，跳跃，冲刺加速跨越一个一个的山崖，从高处落下破坏障碍，都十分的爽快。目前这个游戏我也就接触到了一种敌人，充满暗物质的蜂群。其他敌人没见着。游戏也有一定的收集要素，在游戏的过程中，玩家会渐渐的将动力外骨骼的配件收集完全，从而更好的前往各种地方。
游戏在bgm方面也令人比较满意，优美的bgm舒缓了我在探索途中产生的劳累。
当跑了累，打累了。深呼吸一下，平静一下内心，回首望去，就会发现周边是多么的美妙，无论是哪里，都能成为一套风景线。
评分:9/10 值得推荐！
---------------------------------------------------------2016/9/5--------------------------------------------------------------------
正式通关，游戏流程虽然有点短不够满足。以下是我想说的。
游戏BGM十分的精美，而且出现的时机，氛围，都十分的完美，能让玩家在该紧张时紧张，该兴奋时兴奋，该放松时放松，游戏剧情上也有一定的深度（个人理解方面），最后一幕挺令人深思的，可能这是我的感觉，或许大家的感觉都不一样。这款游戏难度是十分容易的，也没啥费脑的地方，只需要走走，跑跑，打打，带着一份探索的精神，在这片未知的大陆，探寻神秘的废弃工厂，最后，把人类在这片大陆上留下的最后的疤痕给消除掉。就算游戏通关后，我也不舍得关掉游戏，静静的听着BGM，慢慢的给这篇评测添加内容。
评分：10/10  这部作品，给我带来了前所未有的游戏体验，真的，十分的推荐这款作品。遗憾的是就目前游戏流程稍微不够长，这是唯一觉得遗憾的地方了。

This game was far better than I expected. It took me 2 hours and 57 minutes to beat. Your playtime will vary depending on how much putzing around and exploring you do.

 You play as an archilogist who is looking for a fabled artifact called the lifeseed in a mysterious location called "The Valley". Using a L.E.A.F. suit which allows you to run faster, jump higher give/take life at will, plus more - you traverse a good looking environment and follow the story of a mad scientist bent on creating the ultimate superweapon and the rebellion against him.

The movement with the L.E.A.F. suit in this game is fast and fluid and the narrative is interesting and engaging. My only negative would be the combat gets fairly tedious.

25246414.review:
I recomend this to anyone who wants a Journey like experience.  Beautiful world and satisfying gameplay.

Cons: 
-Mouce sensitivity issues currently with a slight delay on input for it.  Not unplayable by any means, just slightly annoying until you get used to it.
-FOV too low and unchangable.
-High system requirements in high settings.  Do not use SSAO or FXAA disable both for greatly improved performance.
-The problem with gameplay is during the running sections they force you to interupt the satisfying fast running and jumping to explore for items.  This does draw me out of my experience a little bit.

Pros:
-Music is sublime!
-Art style fits the theme and music.
-Ultra satisfying mechanics and upgrade system.
-Game has good story flow and progression.
-Beautiful world design.
-Later areas with very minor "horror" elements exploring the evils of humanity.

I'd easily say the cons are worth dealing with and do not really affect your experience unless you are affected by simulation sickness (low FOV and mouce delay).

8/10 (Would be a 9/10, but the fixable Cons affect it too much.)

25223104.review:
[b]Where could I possibly begin?[/b]

Let me start off by saying that at first glance it was the polished graphics that drew me towards this title. And with only a $20 pricetag there was not really a reason to pass this by.

And wow was I blown away once I left the starting area!
It was a tremendous experience playing through Valley. I have had such a great time there, that I will definitely revisit it. The core gameplay mechanic is a simple one (jumping and exploring) but the well written narrative, the sounddesign and the beauty of their world drew me in, immersing me.

Yes there is shooting and you do shoot in order to survive, but its a far cry of mindless slugging away.

[b]What can you expect to find in Valley?[/b]

- Beautifully rendered and realistic world design.
- Exploration in open and enclosed spaces.
- Well-paced and manageable puzzles.
- An awesome soundtrack and great sound-design.
- Shooting mechanics with a twist. (Amrita amirite?)
- Highspeed running and jumping sequences.
- An overall AAA-polish to an indie title.
- Running at 60fps (with custom settings no cap)

[i]What not to expect.[/i]

- Microtransactions
- Heartless and generic story
- Crafting mechanics and hunger meter
- Walking simulator
- Boob-physics
- Typical AAA-cashgrab
- Game crashing bugs

[b]Would I recommend it?[/b]

Yes I strongly recommend this game, it is a must-have title for your library, as it sets the bar for [b]any[/b] developer to a new level.

Thanks for your time.

GH

My Let's Play of Valley: [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4DBi8Yf1_ceyUrMRZfW5HQZi145EHYKV]Click here![/url]

25222324.review:
Heh, I recommend this game, but only barely.  My biggest issues are it's really short and offers no replayability.  The timer says I clocked 7.3 hours in the game, but I beat it in about 5 hours or so.  I ran around for a while after beating it to try to find the rest of the upgrades and get achievements, but got bored and quit without finding all the "acorn doors."

What the game does right (mostly):

- The story idea is interesting.  It's not really all that fleshed out in the game, and some plot points that are hinted at never really turn into anything.

- The controls for jumping and running feel decently fluid.  The grappling hook was a little buggy/imprecise for me.

- No game-breaking bugs at launch.  I fell through the world and got stuck once, and some geometry was a little glitchy, but nothing major since it takes no time at all to run back to where you were.

- The voice acting is not terrible.  The guy doing the voice-over for the Fallout-esque "L.E.A.F." videos is pretty bad, though.  He's not fooling anyone with that accent.

- Fall damage?  YOU are the fall damage.

What could be better:

- The game could use actual combat*.  Your toughest foe is water.  This is a walking simulator with some running and jumping.

- Because there is no combat, the game is laughably easy.  There's a reason why there is no difficulty setting.

- It would be nice if the map would indicate when you had found all upgrades and "acorn doors" in a particular zone.

- Too much of the game is underground and/or in tunnels, and it's so dark in there...

In conclusion, I guess I just wish there was more to this game.  The first time you do a downhill momentum running jump, it's actually very cool.  Unfortunately, after the novelty of that wears off, you're left with a pretty bare bones game.  Is it worth $20?  Well, I don't regret buying it, so I guess that's a yes.  If something else really good was on sale right now, I might feel differently.

It should also be noted that $20 will get you 40 of the best/worst tacos from Jack in the Box.  Good luck beating those in 5 hours.

*Yes, I know you "shoot" at "enemies" but let's be real here, okay?

+ Fun movements

- Sometimes too dark
- Close to ZERO challenge. Only a few fights and they are super simple. Plateforme phases are super easy too.

25208957.review: Solo una parola: fantastico. Storia curata ed affascinante, la possibilità di esplorare un open world realmente aperto, alla S.T.A.L.K.E.R tanto per capirci, dettagliato e sempre nuovo. Un attrezzatura che vi permetterà di spiccare salti enormi e grazie alla quale potrete non solo ammirare da altezze incredibili un vallata di ben 17 km quadrati reali (altro che mondi generati proceduralmente a suon di pixelloni inguardabili), ma anche togliere e dare vita. Un vostro gesto basterà a trasferire energia vitale da un albero ad un povero cerbiatto morto, resuscitandolo, facendovi diventare una sorta di tecno-messia della natura incontaminata. Enigmi da risolvere, antiche rovine, un esoscheletro sperimentale della II Guerra Mondiale semplicissimo da usare, comandi realmente user friendly senza fronzoli ed inutili complicazioni. Tra i punti di forza di questo splendido gioco vi è proprio il realismo nei movimenti, senza per questo dover avere un computer della NASA per farlo girare. Insomma, nel mare magnum delle tante uscite di STEAM, direi un acquisto obbligato. Vale fino all'ultimo centesimo di euro speso.

25207375.review:
[h1]Story:[/h1]
In Valley spielt ihr einen stummen Protagonisten, der in einem "Valley" gelandet ist.
Valley wird dabei von Geistern, Tieren und Bäumen bewohnt.
Ihr sollt nun erforschen, warum die Geister so aggressiv sind, und die Umgebung nach und nach zerfällt.

Valley glänzt dabei nicht mit der Story an sich, sondern eher mit der Inszenierung dieser.
Denn schon nach kurzer Spielzeit, werdet Ihr sowohl den Plot-Twist als auch das Ende vorhersehen.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
Kurz nachdem eure Reise beginnt, findet ihr den sogenannten "L.E.A.F. (Leap Effortlessly though Air Funtionality) Suit."
Durch diesen erhaltet Ihr die Fähigkeiten schneller zu rennen und höhere Distanzen zu überwinden.
Im laufe des Spiels, findet immer größere Upgrades für den SUIT, welche euch neue Fähigkeiten gewähren.
Neben der Fähigkeit schneller zu rennen und höher zu springen, bekommt Ihr außerdem die Fähigkeit, die Lebensenergie von den Bäumen, Tieren und Geistern zu nehmen oder ihnen diese zu geben.

Gebt ihr einem Tier oder einem Baum Lebensenergie, so werden euch diese abgezogen.
Nehmt ihr einem Tier oder einem Baum Lebensenergie, so wird euch diese für euren SUIT gutgeschrieben.

Dabei ist eure Lebensenergie mit der Energie des Suits gebunden.
Also müsst ihr stehts aufpassen, dass ihr genügend Energie mit euch tragt.
Ihr werdet dabei aber nie auf einen Engpass stoßen, da sich genügen Energieressourcen in eurer Umgebung befinden.
Sei es durch herumschwebende Energiebälle, Bäume, Tiere, oder Reaktoren.
Sollte Ihr dennoch sterben, so verliert Ihr ein Blatt, welches euren Respawn-Counter angibt.
Die Blätter lassen sich ebenfalls mit dem geben der Lebensenergie auffüllen.

Ihr trefft in Valley natürlich nicht nur auf gut gelaunte Tiere und Geister, sondern auch auf aggressive Geister.
Diese werdet Ihr aber schon nach kurzer Spieldauer ignorieren.
Der Grund ist recht einfach erklärt: "Sie sind weder herausfordernd, noch sonderlich schwer."
Es gibt zwar unterschiedliche Geister und um so weiter Ihr in der Story voranschreitet, können diese auch mehrere Projektile abfeuern, aber diese treffen so gut wie nie und sind daher ebenfalls keine Bedrohung.
Es ist somit ein interessanter Ansatz, der aber durch die zu leichten Areale nicht glänzen kann.

In Valley geht es aber primär nicht um das Kämpfen, sondern um das Erkunden der Spielwelt & das Sammeln der Ressourcen.
In der kompletten Spielwelt, befinden sich Eicheln & Zahnräder.
Mit diesen könnt ihr Türen öffnen, hinter denen sich meistens Upgrades verstecken.
Neben den Eicheln und Zahnrädern, könnt Ihr auch noch Notizen finden.
Diese lassen euch tiefer in die Geschichte eintauchen, und geben zudem Informationen, über die dort einst wohnenden Personen.

Das volle Potential der Spielwelt, schöpft Valley dabei nicht aus.
Man befindet sich zu oft in Gebäuden, Kanalisationsabschnitten & Katakomben.
Dies ist insofern schade, da die Außenwelt schön inszeniert ist.
Es gibt zwar immer wieder Abschnitte, in denen man auch Außerhalb ist, aber die ewigen Katakomben, fühlen sich länger an, als sie eigentlich sind.

Dazu kommt noch, dass es in der Außenwelt, kaum etwas zu entdecken gibt.
Hier und da liegen zwar Kisten, aber nach einer Zeit, seid Ihr nicht mehr bereit, diese einzusammeln, da das ewige lesen von Notizen und finden von Eicheln und Zahnrädern, keine wirkliche Motivation darstellt.

So folgt Ihr nun der hübsch inszenierten Story und findet heraus, was es mit den aggressiven Geistern, der sterbenden Umwelt und den vorigen Personen auf sich hat.

[h1]Soundtrack:[/h1]
Kommen wir als letztes zum Soundtrack des Spiels.
Um es kurz zu machen, wer die Musik von "Ori and the blind forest" und konsorten mag, der wird auch hier voll auf seine Kosten kommen.
Die Musikstücke passen perfekt zur Umgebung und geben ein wunderbares Feedback, wodurch man sich in die Welt hineinversetzt fühlt.
Valley bietet nicht nur eine ruhige und mystische Stimmung...
...sondern auch eine, die mit Adrenalin nur so strotzt.

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Valley zählt trotz des Umfangs und der mageren Spielzeit, zu meinen TOP-Titeln des Jahres 2016.
Es weiß mit dem hübsch inszenierten visuellen Look und der musikalischen Untermalung zu überzeugen & ich spreche daher eine Empfehlung aus.

25195414.review:
This is a fantastic experience. There have been few games over the past few years that have gotten my adrenaline punmping and all with minimal combat and no cutscenes. Some will write this game off as a walking/running simulator, but it is much deeper. You'll explore, upgrade, engage in light combat and there are even puzzle elements. Moving through this game is exhilerating and while there are invisible walls to hit, it is no easy task to do so. Everything feels open and flowing, even when the path is actually linear. 

It is a bit short, story-wise, but exploring and collectables will add to playtime. Audio recordings fill you in on the story as you progress, but you can find notes hidden throughout the game that give you more background.

The game is not perfect. The are some glitches here and there and sometimes the freedom of movement can actually work against you as I found several places where I was able to get into areas I wasn't supposed to be able to access yet and got stuck as a result. Also it is very easy. The game makes a big deal about balancing life and death of the valley, but energy orbs are plentiful and regenerate so I never really risked running out of energy. If you die, the valley will lose some health as a result, but restoring a half dozen trees will bring it back to full. The lowest it ever got for me was half way when I had some trouble with a jumping section (which was really just me sucking) and even then I had it restored in a matter of minutes.

Overall, the game was a very enjoyable. Free running is thrilling and the world is enchanting. Well worth $20

I'm not sure where to start. First off I'll say I love this game, it's so incredibly well designed. Every second was fun!
The pros would be that it has an amazing and beautiful atmosphere, and it has a great pace that you set your self. You can either fly through it running blazing fast, or stop to take in all the details. The game mechanic itself is really unique and well designed, allowing for lots of exploration. One neutral is that the story can be played through in about 4 or 5 hours. The reason that this is not a con is that you can go back to every location and re-explore, and with suit upgrades you can reach areas previosuly unavailable. I won't complain about the price either, as it was only $20.00. For the experience I had, I would say that is worth it. It's really the most fun I've had in an adventure/puzzle game since Portal 2. The only con (to me) is the fighting mechanic, it's not bad, it's well designed, it just gets a little boring. The upside to this is that there aren't a ton of fights, and you spend much more time taking in the enviroment than you do fighting.
I really do reccomend this to everyone who just wants to relax and have fun, and explore the beautiful world the devs created.

25184966.review:
Valley is an enjoyable and fun game, inspiring both a sense of wonder while having its certainly exhilirating moments. With a fun focus on movement, it is certainly a good, if somewhat brief, time. 

The difficulty in the game is very low, and though there are combat elements within the game, the combat is hardly a central part to the game, and can hardly be called combat. The real joy of the experience is certainly within the fast paced freedom of movement. 

It's a little on the short side, but not excessively short, leaving room for exploration and experimentation. 

Pros:
+Beautiful visuals and art direction, if a bit minimalistic at times. Does not try to exploit nostalgia.
+Great sense of movement, exhilirating even.
+An engaging and memorable though ultimately minimalistic story and setting, though a bit short as well. 
+A spectacular soundtrack, definitely worth purchasing the Game + Soundtrack combo. 

Cons:
-Uses the Unity engine, bringing performance troubles with it.
-Could have used a bit more length overall. 
-Though the linearity is not necessarily a bad thing and is not poorly executed, it does feel like there is a lot of potential that could have been had with more open world elements.

YMMV:
/ Low difficulty provides relatively little threat and challenge, or much need to use resources or health wisely. Some may prefer this as it will allow them a streamlined, easygoing experience. Some may have desired more challenge to accompany the freedom of movement.
/ Underdeveloped combat and resource management elements may hint at unused potential. Some will prefer this easygoing experience, others may have desired more depth to those elements and a stronger need to utilize them.

Overall, Valley is a brief but memorable experience that is certainly worth a play if you find yourself desiring a simple, low-stress and straightforward yet still strong and engaging game, providing that much needed sense of wonder and fantasy without having too much depth to the lore to try and dig for or search out. It is best described as a definite gem, unfortunately overshadowed by higher profile releases around the same time, but absolutely deserves more attention!

Verdicts: 
Buy it now: Those who are very hungry for an engaging yet simple and stress-free experience, craving a sense of wonder and immersion.
Wait for sale: All others

25178632.review:
Wow! Just wow! This game came unexpected. Never heard of it before. The screenshots looked a bit like a walking simulator with a few gameplay elements. The description was vague. I didn't expect too much. To be honest, I just bought it because I had wallet left from trading card sales, so I had to pay only 2€ on top of that. But now that I know the game - it's easily worth the money. It really blew me away!

When you start the game, you will in fact think this is a walking simulator. After just a few minutes - when you get your suit - you will probably think: oh, it's more of a running simulator. This will be fun! Well, the game actually has absolutely nothing to do with a walking simulator. It opens up more and more and more. At some point even combat is introduced. The game takes its time, so that when you have your first fight, you are really surprised that this is in the game. You get new upgrades for your suit on a regular basis. And what awesome upgrades those are. I'd say the double jump is the least exciting of them. Wait until you are in your first speed tunnel... ;)

Aside from all that the game has this really great life/death mechanic. You can take life, and you can give life. This works with animals, trees and other plants. So if you really need it, you can take from nature. But don't take too much. The valley itself also has some sort of HP meter. It's an interesting and innovative concept. I like it a lot.

The story is mostly told through audio logs and notes. This may sound boring to some of you, but it really isn't. You listen to the audio logs while playing, and the notes are pretty short - so neither of those will hinder your game flow. The story is pretty interesting. It didn't take long until I really wanted to know what the hell happened in the valley.

The graphics are awesome. And the sound design is absolutely fantastic. The world is well designed and interesting. Well, almost everything about this game is just great. The only negative thing I can think of is the difficulty. It's a little too easy. But that's really a minor complaint.

My playthrough was exactly 5:57h long.

Overall this is just a great game. A real indie gem. And I hope it get's the attention it deserves.

And if you're using a 21:9 monitor like me, please check this out: http://steamcommunity.com/app/378610/discussions/0/352792037314730094/

25171297.review:
I'm going to start with the bad and just get it out of the way. There's some pretty janky things going on right now. Mouse sensitivity is WAY too high, I had to lower the sensitivity as far as it would go AND reduce my mouse' DPI to 200 to get a playable sensitivity. To make the game run higher than 60fps I had to set VSync ON to 60 fps, at which point the game ran at around 90-100 in open areas, and a nice 144 in indoor areas. There is combat in the game, but it's really basic and pitifully easy. The devs have stated that they are going to attempt to fix the technical issues in a patch hopefully by 8/29, this is going up on 8/26.

All of that being said, it was a wonderful experience. The meat of the game is the first-person platforming. This game is a bit deceptive, in the first five minutes it feels like a walking simulator. Then suddenly it opens up and gives you a powered exoskeleton that sets you loose to perform incredible feats of strength and agility. The mechanic of being able to drain life of plants and animals to power your suit to perform some of the more intensive functions is cool, as is being able to give that life back through the aptly named "God Hand." What the game ends up being is an interesting science fiction romp through a visually pleasing mountain valley and eerie dilapidated  WWII research facilities. The soundtrack is also excellent and fit the theme of each level that I dashed, jumped, and swung my way through. I felt like I was playing a Miyazaki film, and that’s high praise. 

For those of you that like to get that little bit extra out of your games, there’s a couple types of collectables to gather, and secret areas to find that either give you some more of the collectables, a bit more background story, or both. These collectables are scattered throughout the world in chests, and the secret areas often hide upgrades to your exoskeleton itself. The bad here is there is no sort of tracker in regards to how many of each level’s collectables and secret areas you’ve located. I found just the simple exercise of finding collectables and secret areas enjoyable in and of itself. If you only go for collectables for the sake of getting that 100% completion, I can see you getting irritated. If you’re like me and you’re interested more in the gratification of finding these things yourself, that little thrill when you find them, you’ll probably have plenty of fun. You can travel back to areas earlier in the game and keep your suit upgrades, your total item collections, and even story progress. This takes away some of the sting of missing things earlier on, because you can return, and since just traversing the levels is often the most fun part, it still feels satisfying. 

Mechanically, the movement mechanics feel satisfying. First person platforming can often feel frustrating and unresponsive, but here everything felt appropriate. The ability to look down and see your feet helps you to guide yourself to exactly where you want to land, and enough variety in the puzzles to keep things feeling fresh throughout the four to six hours that the game will likely take you to reach the end. What combat there is didn’t blow my mind, and while it feels a bit lackluster compared to the platforming, it’s not so hard as to ever become tedious. The one boss battle of the game was interesting enough for me to accept it, as it was as enjoyable as the combat ever got and did add a lot more to a fight, and added in more complex movement and dodging that played more to the game’s strength than the rest of the combat in the game. 

I enjoyed my time with the game enough after my six hours of playing to get through the main story. I am also planning on to go back and get the collectables that I missed. I highly recommend this game, but as always, do the proper research before buying. Watch a bit of gameplay videos, read reviews, etc.

25168921.review:
Simply put, I found myself repeatedly giggling and yelling out with "Wheeeeeeee!" at 2am. Take that as you will!

Both the story and collectibles feel like an unnecessary additions that stuttered the game's sense of flow, but there are a surprisingly large number of intrinsically fun moments to be had, especially surrounding the joy of movement itself. 

Greatly helping with this is that the majority of the game uses an expert sense of lighting-cues to indicate how the player should progress, which is both efficient for the player and preserves immersion. The efficacy of such lighting makes the game's few confusing/ambiguous areas all the more obvious since then the (typical of modern games) faulty waypoint system becomes the primary navigation tool.

The experience offered is notably short (~3 hours), so use your own judgement on whether or not you think you'd enjoy it at the current price.

For me personally, I thought it was a joyful experience that was worth the price paid.

25140049.review:
[b]Valley[/b] is a first-person action game with little bits of other genres woven in.  For instance, it almost reminds me of a walking sim early on, and then when you get a L.E.A.F. suit it's a bit more exploratory.  The suit itself has some nice capabilities, like taking and giving life to creatures around you.  The running and jumping is a really nice aspect to the suit, which feels very free and invigorating to me in a sense.  You can also essentially "live forever" as long as you have energy to replenish the life around you as you take life from the areas you are in.  This is key for collecting the acorns as well, since trees tend to drop acorns on a regular basis.  

It's not a very long game, but the areas are fairly sizable and vast.  There is some really nice equipment upgrading as you continue on, and several types of collectible items to collect for acorn doors, which are locked without the proper amount of acorns, and some mysterious medallions you find in certain boxes with a slight shiny glint you can see from afar if you're in the right spots called pendulum cases as you travel different areas.  You can go back and forth as you please with the Travel option in the pause menu as well, if you gain new upgrades and want to explore around some previous areas.

When hostiles start to appear on the map, you have some very slight FPS elements involved in targeting while being attacked.  This is extremely light, and I don't find the difficulty to be a problem at all in this game.  I find it a little short, but compared to other games at this price range, the grapics and music and complete package make it one of the better games on Steam I have played in this price range.

One gripe I have is the look sensitivity was extremely fast!  I had to move it all the way to about five percent from the lowest setting in options to use it with my controller.  This probably should be updated.  I also fell through rocks a few times while exploring out of the way areas, as well as some ceilings that I went above.  A few times I was completely stuck, and I had to restart the area.  Things you collect are still accounted for, so you don't have to redo everything again and again, aside from getting to the spot where you need to be.  In this suit, that's not too hard to do, generally.

As mentioned, the time was a little short, but I'd rather complain a good game was too short, than play a bad game and constantly hope the next part is the end of it.  Most people don't even bother in the latter case, but I can be a bit of a masochist in that respect...  Sometimes bad games are so bad they end up good, and sometimes they are so bad they have a lot of humor along the way.  It's refreshing when I find one of those that bring something to the table, intentional or not.


[h1]Pros[/h1]

Great graphics!  I really loved the colors as I went from area to area.  It kind of speaks for itself in game photos and video, or some of the screenshots I took as I travelled around.  It's beautiful!

The music is really relaxing on relaxing parts, pretty intense on intense parts, and overall fits your surrounding scenery or goals.  It's what I would call "world music" if I were selecting a style or genre, but the use of instrumentation reminded me of the Uncharted games a bit.  It's not constant, but will change or calm down.  It is not overpowering, and I liked not feeling like I needed to cut the volume down or anything while playing at any point.

The L.E.A.F. suit is a lot of fun!  The jumping and running around is very freeing and you can almost feel it as you traverse landscapes.  I won't go into detail on this one, but they have some really good upgrades too, especially later on as you move through the game's story.

The creatures you encounter are awesome too!  They are called, or rather nicknamed, daemons, as you learn, and the bigger ones don't really have a name.  I won't talk much about that, since that is something the story will eventually get you up to speed with.

Collecting things along the way to unlock other things.  This is something you can go back through to balance out some of the shortness factor that I kind of complained a bit about, sort of.  Going back with all the upgrades can help you find a lot of what you may have missed earlier, or just focusing on finding the rest of the items, if you choose to do so.

I liked the text that would come up here and there of your own thoughts.  As you entered an area that sparked a thought, you would see something on the sides of the screen as you went along.  Simple concept, but it worked, I thought.


[h1]Cons[/h1]

The length of the game could be a little longer, but honestly, this is not a huge complaint for me.  It fit the whole story well for me, but in a way I always want games to be longer, even a game I spend 100 hours or more on, if it's good. 

Glitches where I was stuck in rocks, or fell through and couldn't get back into the map.  I only fell a little, but I usually had trouble finding a way back, especially when I only had the basic suit.  

I would like to see difficulty created.  It was very very easy for me.  I'm not so much complaining about my own experience as much as for some that might like a more challenging experience.

A map.  I couldn't find any sort of a map feature.  There is a small bar, like many Bethesda games have, where it has the compass kind of thing near the top, and the "point of interest" is marked as a red spot, but I would like one where I could see the layout of everything. Wasn't able to find this, if in fact there is one.  Would love it if there ever is one!

The story is... a bit generic in some respects, but in others I like that it sort of makes you wonder and question things as you're going along.  There are some twists that make it more interesting than your average story of this type of war and madness-driven power.


[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

I think I stated it all in the original few paragraphs, but for this price range, this is one of the best games I've played on Steam.  It's an experience all its own, and I recommend this at full price if you're looking for a single game on Steam you want to spend $20 (or whatever your currency may be).  I personally love sales, since I have a big frugal side, but this game is something I doubt anyone purchasing will regret playing!  Amazing game!  

Easily at least 10/10

25126593.review:
Well, I finished it in under six hours, so it's not a long game. However, I didn't 100% it, and I intend to go back and do more.

But value propositions aside, I got this game after seeing Jim Sterling play it, and the running and jumping, the sense of speed and momentum, looked so fun. It is. I did not get tired of it at all. This game does speed excellently. Perhaps perfectly. Thus, it was worth the price to me. Whethe it provides enough value to you, well, is up to you.

In addition it solves the problem of first-person platforming by both letting you see your feet, and always providing platforms big enough you can judge your positioning with no problem. Thus, the platforming is very fun.

The shooting, too, is quite good. It's minimal, but where it shines is when you find yourself soaring through the air and shooting things (to life or death) before you land. That is quite satisfying, and almost makes me want a challenge mode or to try speedrunning it.

There are two other mechanics: a grappling hook and magnetic boots. The magnetic boots, in my opinion, feel awful. The transition from walking on a wall to jumping off or vice versa is jarring and not at all smooth. In addition, twice it bugged out and gravity still applied to me, so I just fell. The grappling hook, however, I quite liked, once I got used to it, though it can be fiddly remembering to hold down the button to keep it attached, which killed me a couple times.

Then there's the fact it is gorgeous and the soundtrack is amazing. My only complaint with this is that about half the game isn't in the gorgeous valley but often rather dull interiors, which is quite a shame. They could've easily been designed better to solve the dullness problem too, but I shant spoil how.

The soundtrack, meanwhile, has only one problem: the running tracks are too good. Too exciting. And when you're just wanting to pause and find collectibles or read notes in a speedy section that can be a bit jarring.

Lastly, the story's good. It's not remarkable, but it's solid. And it is told all through environmental notes scattered around and audio logs, in very much a walking simulatoresque style, which some people will have a problem with, but I found myself engaged in it.

Really, in many ways this game feels like it owes much to walking simulators like Everybody's Gone to the Rapture, except they then made it a proper game. They added gameplay. I don't hate walking simulators, but really, they're not games, they're digital art pieces, and can only be judged by their story and beauty. This has those as well as being a great game.

25123353.review:
Finished the game in a few hours.
Very interesting storyline. Reminds me of SOMA in terms of gameplay vs. "walking simulator" as well as solid depth of story. Truthfully I bought the game more for the soundtrack...

I'm not a fan of walking simulators, but thankfully Valley introduces new gameplay elements each chapter so even the game play changes so the game is not boring to play. If you've ever wanted to play a game piloting a mech that is stronger and faster than you, this is a very enjoyable game. 

Beginning is a bit slow, but that's fine. It's a tutorial level and it does pick up a bit after that.

25123207.review:
SUMMARY
The Valley is a Adventure/Platformer which you play the role of an adventure trying to prove that relic of the past truly exist. This adventure will find himself in new land that to the world doesnt exist which leads into the question could the thing he is searching for truly be real.

REVIEW
Note i haven't completely finished this game so may take this review as you like. Also there is a video attached to this just see the beginning of the game. So with that i must mention i have been waiting for this game since it was announced by Blue Isle Studios. To start I think the idea of this game is quiet brilliant and even if some say it is a walking simulator that is not true. The Mechanics work like their supposed to and i haven't seen any glitches so far. The Graphics are very well done and it actual looks like the studio put a lot of work into this game.

OPITMIZATION
Most of you want to know if it runs well on your computer. Well knowing it just released it's not 100% polished which i have come to expect as of late of most games. However, it runs way better than most.
My Rig Runs on a 1080gtx and I5 core processor with 16gb ram. So i can say that i dont have a overpowered PC. 
Max Settings at 2560 x 1440 gives me an average of 30-40 Frames which is probably due to its jsut release. For those who have a 2k moniter i suggest that you turn the AA to FXAA or SMAA Low/Medium which seems to run at 55-60fps. For 1080p, my rig easily runs the game at 60fps with not drops even with SMAA high so for those who don't really care about resolution you will have no issues running it if you have a some what similar rig. NOTE: that it might be different for those who have lower end PCs

CONCLUSION
I would surely try this game becauase it is rare thing to see a game such as this to come out. Especially when the current stance of the PC community as gone to the wolves(aka developers who dont care about us). However, i will leave up for you to decide if you want to play this game. If you think that its not worth the price just remember that these game designers put alot of work into it and it is their livlihood. 

VIDEO
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=751275412

25122621.review:
[h1]This game is absolutely breathtaking.[/h1]

What starts for five minutes as a walking simulator immediately evolves into Tribes Ascend, skiing down slopes and shooting projectile ressurection into dead flora and fauna like Captain Planet. Not satisfied with emulating just one superhero, they give you a spiderman-like grappling hook. You'll grapple and fly around with some of the most fluid, solid controls I've ever seen for a first person game. Soaring across huge gaps, grappling high through the sky and slamming into destructable ground feels so [i]gratifying.[/i]

Everything looks beautiful, the levels have actual clever design and objectives that require you to do more than just press W. Even the environments exceeded my expectations as nature begins to give way for the remnants of a dilapidated, rusty military base. Expect to take about [u]three hours[/u] from start to finish as you explore this huge island. 

The one and only downside to this game is that no one's paying attention to it. This game is a real gemstone buried undeneath the marketing machine shreking incessantly about all the broken promises No Man's Sky failed to deliver on. Hopefully people will catch onto this game and realize it's one of the finest indie titles this year.

25122167.review:
Чуть больше двух часов ушло у меня, чтобы пройти эту игру от начала до конца. Не вчитываясь в заметки, лежащие под носом, слушая лишь аудиовставки дневников персонажей.

Сразу скажу, я получил огромное удовольствие. Игра полностью окупает стоимость. Она красива и динамична.
Но графика не слишком далеко ушла от Скайрима (что можно понять и простить, ведь это продукт инди-студии). Тем более, что шейдеры и дизайн вытаскивают ее на приемлемый уровень.

Динамичность создается паркуром в самых разных условиях. Гарантирую, вы будете приятно удивлены их разнообразием.

Левел-дизайн хорош. Не однообразный, всегда легко понять, куда нам следует идти (хотя в некоторорых местах я потупил минут 5). И даже маркер присутствует, на случай, если вы страдаете топографическим кретинизмом (как я, но я лечусь).

Что касается сюжета - банальный, но красиво поданый. В принципе, требуется лишь базовые знания английского, чтобы понимать, о чем говорится в очередной записке. Минус, что локализации не подвезли.

Реиграбельность... Нет ее. Вообще. Разве что вы хотите перерыть все локации, чтобы найти местные аналоги ключей - "желуди" и "медальоны". Они открывают доступ к кусочкам лора и апгрейдам. Без них играть ничуть не сложнее. Местный аналог ХП у меня ни разу не падал ниже половины (3-4 ячейки по 5 пунктов). 

Багов не заметил совсем. Единственное что - периодически подвисал на подгрузках локаций (2-3 раза за всю игру). 

Итог... 8/10, один хороший вечер и приятное послевкусие. Рекомендую.

25121856.review:
It's short (I finished the storyline in just under 4 hours), although there is some 100%ing that could be done, but it was still a good experience. I found myself unable to turn it off before finsishing it.

The gameplay is fun and the graphics are nice, with a brilliant soundtrack.

Looks good so far but be warned the mouse look sensitivity is way too high.

Not a big deal but either this is the signs of a quick port or perhaps the devs play with really low DPI mice? I have it turned down to the minimum and its still really twitchy. 

Either way the game looks promising. More once I've finished.

25120654.review: This game was amazing starts off a little slow but i liked it because i like to find hidden stuff and items, also insane graphics and the ending was perfect! 10/10

25120134.review:
I like short games; games that don't waste your time or don't overstay their welcome. Superhot is one of those games and belonging in that category is Valley. What it does it does well. It makes you feel fast and powerful. It also revolves around the concept of life and death in an interesting fashion. 

You go into the mountains looking for the Lifeseed; a powerful artifact said to contain incredible power. What you find is much more than just the Lifeseed.

Gameplay-wise, first-person platforming and light shooter elements are your main components. Some may categorize this as a walking simulator, it certainly has the feel of one but has actual enjoyable gameplay to it.

Valley only asks for 3 hours of your time for one playthrough but there are secrets and extra unlockables that you can only get through exploring, so your play time may differ.

Overall score: 8/10
(I really liked it)

25119193.review: I did enjoy this game for the first few hours, but DO NOT use the travel function. I had a game breaking glitch and now objectives wont show up and i cant progress. but the main mechanics are very enjoyable.

25116343.review:
[quote=Морис Метерлинк]Граница нашего познанья кажется нам достоверной, но единственно, что в ней достоверно, — это наше неведение.[/quote]

Студия [b]Blue Isle Studios[/b], подарившая миру одну из лучших игровых реализаций про Тонкого человека, долго держала игроков в неведении о своем следующем проекте. В начале этого года разработчики анонсировали научно-фантастическое приключение под названием [b]Valley[/b]. По словам генерального директора Алекса Тинтора, новый проект подарит игрокам нечто совершенно иное, непохожее на прошлое творение студии.

По сюжету главный герой игры занимается поисками таинственной реликвии под названием [b]Lifeseed[/b], которая, согласно преданиям, способна подарить своему владельцу невиданную силу. Поиски заводят протагониста в отдаленный район Скалистых Гор, в сокрытую от человеческих глаз долину. Там он, или она в зависимости от вашего выбора, находит экзоскелет L.E.A.F., разработанный военными во времена Второй мировой войны. Новый костюм повышает физические возможности владельца, позволяя выше прыгать, быстрее передвигаться, а также контролировать жизненную силу живых существ. С новыми способностями герой все больше погружается в тайны загадочной долины, которые хранятся здесь уже на протяжении нескольких тысячелетий.

На первых порах можно наблюдать великолепные по красоте пейзажи, зайцев и оленей, спешащих по своим делам, и странных существ похожих на привидений, которые не проявляют никакой агрессии по отношению к герою. Хочется отметить работу дизайнеров и художников [b]Blue Isle Studios[/b], благодаря их труду атмосфера создается просто великолепная, а также качественный саундтрек с фольклорными напевами, композиторы также не забыли внести свою лепту, возникает желание просто побегать и поизучать окрестности, любуясь красотами местности. Однако, не обольщайтесь, за всем этим великолепием спрятаны достаточно жуткие вещи, которые будут открываться перед взором игрока по мере погружения в детали сюжета.

Игра разбита на подуровни, каждый из которых представляет из себя небольшой участок долины. В любой из пройденных этапов можно вернуться, ведь по мере развития сюжета мы обзаведемся дополнительными аксессуарами для нашего костюма, тем самым получая новые способности. Например, уже после получаса игры мы научимся двойному прыжку, что позволит добраться до некоторых, ранее недоступных мест, некоторые из которых, к слову, спрятаны очень хорошо.

Важно отметить интересную особенность костюма, которая позволяет герою воскресать после смерти. Правда, это не проходит бесследно. Один из постулатов естествознания, сформулированный еще М. В. Ломоносовым гласит: [i]«Все встречающиеся в природе изменения происходят так, что если к чему-либо нечто прибавилось, то это отнимается у чего-то другого»[/i]. Так и в игре, в долине умирают деревья и животные, передавая свою жизненную энергию протагонисту. Можно наблюдать печальную картинку, если злоупотреблять этой способностью.

Из минусов можно отметить некоторую линейность геймплея, ведь возвращаться назад вовсе не обязательно, это носит скорее рекомендательный характер. Иногда, можно наткнуться на невидимые стены, если очень активно заниматься поисками секретных мест.

[u]Плюсы:[/u]
☞ Интересный сюжет с элементами мистики и научной фантастики.
☞ Качественное звуковое сопровождение и отличная графика.
☞ Оптимизация.
☞ Множество секретов.
☞ Нескучный геймплей, благодаря возможностям экзоскелета L.E.A.F.
☞ Атмосфера.

[u]Минусы:[/u]
☜ Относительная линейность.
☜ Невидимые стены.

[u]Итог:[/u]
[i][b]Valley[/b] - великолепный приключенческий экшен от первого лица, который подарит вам уникальный игровой опыт и удивительно красивый мир, полный загадок. Моя оценка 8,5 баллов из 10![/i]
